intro: Piptolepis monticola, commonly known as the mountain piptolepis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Piptolepis monticola is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
